arguments.name: type
arguments.description: The type of menu. Currently 'left' and 'right' are supported.

arguments.name: mode
arguments.description: Sets the mode of the menu. Currently 'default', 'push', 'ios', 'reveal', 'squeeze' and 'squeeze-reveal' are supported.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The percentage of the screen the menu will take when opened.

arguments.name: maxWidth
arguments.description: The maximum width of the menu in pixels. Set to -1 to disable;

arguments.name: maskEnabled
arguments.description: Whether or not a mask is added when the menu is opened.

arguments.name: shadowEnabled
arguments.description: Whether or not a shadow is added to the menu.

arguments.name: triggerVelocity
arguments.description: The default swipe velocity needed to fully open the menu.

arguments.name: onToggle
arguments.description: Hook which is called after the transition with the new menu isOpen state.

arguments.name: onOpen
arguments.description: Hook fired when the menu is opened. You can pass in an action. The menu instance will be passed to the action.

arguments.name: onClose
arguments.description: Hook fired when the menu is closed. You can pass in an action. The menu instance will be passed to the action.

component:ember-mobile-menu/components/m.title: MobileMenuToggle
component:ember-mobile-menu/components/m.text: A toggle component to open or close a menu.

attributes.name: MobileMenuToggle
attributes.description: A toggle component to open or close a menu.

arguments.name: onClick
arguments.description: Hook fired when the toggle is clicked. You can pass in an action.

component:ember-mobile-menu/components/m.title: MobileMenuWrapper
component:ember-mobile-menu/components/m.text: Wrapper component for menu's. Provides pan recognition and management.

attributes.name: MobileMenuWrapper
attributes.description: Wrapper component for menu's. Provides pan recognition and management.

fields.name: boundingClientRect
fields.description: Current BoundingClientRect of the mobile menu wrapper root element

methods.name: _isIOSbrowser
methods.description: Detect if the user is using the app from a browser on iOS

returns.description: Returns true when the user is using iOS and is inside a browser

arguments.name: openDetectionWidth
arguments.description: Horizontal width of the detection zone in pixels. Set to -1 to use full width.

arguments.name: capture
arguments.description:
If true the capture phase will be used for the event, giving it precedence over events in the (default) bubble phase. This is handy for menus as they are usually defined high in the dom, are opened with edge gestures and thus must take precedence over deeper nested elements by using the capture phase.

See https://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/#event-flow for more details.

arguments.name: preventScroll
arguments.description: If true, the component tries to prevent scroll when a menu is open

yields.name: position
yields.description: Current position of the active menu in px.

yields.name: relativePosition
yields.description: Current position of the active menu between 0 and 1.

component:ember-mobile-menu/components/m.title: LinkTo
component:ember-mobile-menu/components/m.text: An extended LinkTo component which provides an onClick hook.

attributes.name: LinkTo
attributes.description: An extended LinkTo component which provides an onClick hook.

arguments.name: onClick
arguments.description: Hook called when the link is clicked.

component:ember-mobile-menu/components/m.title: Mask
component:ember-mobile-menu/components/m.text: A mask component. You usually do not need to use this component yourself. Whether or not a mask is present can be set by passing an argument to the MobileMenu component.

attributes.name: Mask
attributes.description:
A mask component.

You usually do not need to use this component yourself. Whether or not a mask is present can be set by passing an argument to the MobileMenu component.

arguments.name: maskOpacityOffset
arguments.description:
Offset (or "deadzone") used when calculating what opacity the mask should currently be.

Example: the default value is 0.1. This means the mask will only become visible after the position is over 10% of the screen width.

functions.name: normalizeCoordinates
functions.description: Normalizes coordinates in the passed TouchData to the BoundingClientRect of the passed element

params.name: bcr
params.description: The DOMRect of the element to which the coordinates need to be normalized.

template:docs/components/menu-wrapper.title: Mobile Menu Wrapper
template:docs/components/menu-wrapper.text: Mobile Menu Wrapper This component manages the state of the menus and does the initial pan recognition. It is the main entry point for using this addon. By default it is set up to detect a pan from respectively the left or the right edge depending on the chosen menu(s). <MobileMenuWrapper as |mmw|> <mmw.MobileMenu as |mm|> <mm.LinkTo @route="index">Home</mm.LinkTo> </mmw.MobileMenu> <mmw.Content> <mmw.Toggle>Menu</mmw.Toggle> </mmw.Content> </MobileMenuWrapper> Open detection width The @openDetectionWidth argument controls the size in px of the area that will be used for dragging from an "edge" of the content. If set to -1 the full width of the content can be used to drag open the menu. <MobileMenuWrapper @openDetectionWidth={{30}} as |mmw|> ... </MobileMenuWrapper> Left & Right menus By default the menu is setup to be a left menu. By passing type=right to the menu you can make the menu slide in from the right. <MobileMenuWrapper as |mmw|> <mmw.MobileMenu @type="right" as |mm|> <mm.LinkTo @route="index">Home</mm.LinkTo> </mmw.MobileMenu> <mmw.Content> <mmw.Toggle>Menu</mmw.Toggle> </mmw.Content> </MobileMenuWrapper> Multiple menus You can also use both a left and a right menu. A target option is available on the toggle component to target a specific menu (defaults to left or the only available menu if there is just one). <MobileMenuWrapper as |mmw|> <mmw.MobileMenu @type="left" as |mm|> <mm.LinkTo @route="index">Home</mm.LinkTo> </mmw.MobileMenu> <mmw.Content> <mmw.Toggle @target="left">Left Menu</mmw.Toggle> <mmw.Toggle @target="right">Right Menu</mmw.Toggle> </mmw.Content> <mmw.MobileMenu @type="right" as |mm|> <mm.LinkTo @route="index">Home</mm.LinkTo> </mmw.MobileMenu> </MobileMenuWrapper> Embedded menu The menu can also be used embedded on a page by passing embed=true to the <MobileMenuWrapper/> component. This means the menus will stay within the boundaries of the <MobileMenuWrapper/> component which can be useful for more complicated desktop layouts. If a menu is not embedded, the assumption is made that the Content component takes the full width of the viewport. Home Menu

template:docs/components/menu.title: Mobile Menu
template:docs/components/menu.text: Mobile Menu This component is yielded from mobile-menu-wrapper. It represents a menu instance. Modes A menu component takes an @mode argument which represents how it will function. Mode Primary use case Description default mobile, small screens Default overlay menu. push mobile Pushes the content. reveal mobile Content is dragged away, revealing the menu. ios mobile Similar to reveal but the menu has 1/3 the translation of the user's pan. squeeze tablet, desktop A push style menu which squeezes the content keeping everything in view. squeeze-reveal tablet, desktop Similar to squeeze but with a reveal style menu. If you have two menu instances left and right they can have distinct modes. Shadow The @shadowEnabled argument enables or disables a dynamic shadow, which gets stronger as the menu is opened, for menu's which "overlay" the content. These are default, squeeze and push modes. For the other modes this argument will apply a fixed shadow to the Content component. Mask The @maskEnabled argument enables or disables a mask which will overlay the content. By default it's opacity is linked to the current progress of the pan. The background color of the mask can be set through CSS. Clicking the mask will close the menu. Menu width The width of the menu can be controller by two arguments: @width and @maxWidth. @width is as a percentage of the width of the <MobileMenuWrapper/> component. @maxWidth is a maximum width passed in as pixels. It can be set to -1 to disable the maximum width. This can be used to for example create a full width iOS style menu.

template:docs/index.title: Introduction
template:docs/index.text: Introduction An ember-cli addon providing a draggable sidebar tailored to mobile devices. Both a left and a right menu are supported. Dragging is supported through touch events as supported by any modern (mobile) browser. The sidebar provides an empty canvas suitable for any content. An optional Android theme is supplied.

template:docs/quickstart.title: Quickstart
template:docs/quickstart.text: Quickstart To get started the <MobileMenuWrapper/> component needs to be placed high in the dom so that it wraps the entirety of your app's content on which the gestures need to be detected. From this component you can then yield a content, toggle and menu component to which you can pass a block of content. An extended <LinkTo/> component is available which closes the menu on click. The content component should wrap your pages content. It will react to gestures and adjust its styles as needed. <MobileMenuWrapper as |mmw|> <mmw.MobileMenu as |mm|> <mm.LinkTo @route="index">Home</mm.LinkTo> </mmw.MobileMenu> <mmw.Content> <mmw.Toggle>Menu</mmw.Toggle> </mmw.Content> </MobileMenuWrapper>

template:docs/usage.title: Usage
template:docs/usage.text: Usage Installation From your application directory run: ember install ember-mobile-menu The addon will automatically add the necessary SCSS import to your app.scss or (if ember-cli-sass is not present) add the required CSS to the vendor bundle. NOTE: the minimum supported Ember version is 3.13.

template:index.title: Mode
template:index.text: Nick Schot info@example.com Home Menu Open your dev tools and switch to responsive mode to try the gestures! Mode default reveal ios push squeeze squeeze-reveal Type left right Open detection width -1 (whole width) 30 (px, drag from edge) Other options mask shadow Configure
